name: Close-grip Press-ups
how_to_perform:
1. Begin in a high plank position with your hands placed directly below your chest, closer together than shoulder-width, with your fingers pointed forward or slightly inwards.
2. Keep your body in a straight line from head to heels, engaging your core muscles throughout the movement.
3. Lower your body by bending your elbows, keeping them close to your body as you descend.
4. Continue to lower until your chest is just above the floor, maintaining a controlled and stable movement.
5. Press up through your palms, extending your elbows to return to the starting plank position.
6. Ensure your elbows remain close to your body throughout the exercise to maximize tricep engagement.
7. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions while maintaining proper form.
short_summary: Close-grip Press-ups focus on the triceps by performing a press-up with hands placed closer than shoulder-width apart.
alternative_names: Diamond Push-ups (when hands form a diamond shape)
